intro: Uralepis pilosa, commonly known as the hairy uralepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow-orange flower heads that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open grasslands. Uralepis pilosa is relatively drought-tolerant, making it adaptable to arid environments.
